properties.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 5 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with
gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the first Hard Freeze Watch,
sub- freezing temperatures as low as 22 possible. For the second
Hard Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26
possible.

* WHERE...Santa Ynez Valley.

* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening.
For the first Hard Freeze Watch, from Monday evening through
Tuesday morning. For the second Hard Freeze Watch, from
Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and
make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Freezing conditions could kill crops, other sensitive
vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds late this afternoon into
this evening.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
